tourBios.intlVics: (4) 2014 Kentucky Open, 2013 Kentucky Open, 2013 Eagle's Landing Classic [NGA], 2012 Cherry Blosson Classic [NGA].
tourBios.curYrHigh: Carded four sub-par rounds to finish T9 at the PGA TOUR Latinoamérica season opening 69th Avianca Colombia Open in February.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished the Web.com Tour season having played in all 25 events. Had five top 10s, six top-25s and made 14 cuts. Was 52nd on the combined final money list...Barely a week after the birth of his first child, finished T6 in the season-opening Panama Claro Championship in his second career start on Tour...Made his first Tour hole-in-one at the Chile Classic in the second round...Later in March, went bogey-free through the first 40 holes of the Chitimacha Louisiana Open. Was four back at the halfway mark. Opened with four consecutive birdies in the third round en route to a 65 to take solo possesion of the lead. A 73 on Sunday dropped him into a T4 finish...Made his next four cuts, which included a T10, thanks to a final-round 63 at Thornblade Club...Then contended all week at the Greater Dallas Open with rounds of 69-64-69-67 for a 19-under 269. The T5 performance moved him inside the top 25 on the money list to No. 22...Coming off two missed cuts in a row, got things back on track at the Albertsons Boise Open. Was T4 through 54 holes. Shot 70 on Sunday to finish T9...Ended the Regular Season with a T21 at the WinCo Foods Portland Open to enter the Finals 36th in earnings. Played all 21 Regular Season events...Stumbled in Web.com Tour Finals, missing three cuts and withdrawing once. 

2014: Played 17 PGA Tour Latinoamérica events and recorded four runner-up performances, including two playoff losses (TransAmerican Power Products CRV Open and the Dominican Republic Open). Entered the Tour's final event No. 5 on the Order of Merit but got bumped to No. 6 when he finished T17 at the season-ending VISA Open de Argentina. Finishing fifth would have secured him Web.com Tour status in 2015. The sixth-place finished provided him a spot in the Web.com Tour Q-School Finals, where he finished seventh, giving him excellent status to start the 2015 season. 

2013: Won the 94th Kentucky Open by four shots at The Club at Old Stone in Bowling Green, Kentucky. Shot 68, 66 and 74 to finish the 54-hole event at 8-under 208… Played on the NGA Tour, where he won the Eagle's Landing Classic.

2012: Won the NGA Tour's Cherry Blosson Classic in May. Posted rounds of 71, 63, 65 and 66 for a total of 265 (-23) in Georgetown, Kentucky… Was part of a 12-man cast that participated on The Golf Channel's Big Break Greenbrier. The show's 18th season was taped in June and started airing in October. He finished in the final four.

2009: Turned pro in May.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: A member of the golf team at Middle Tennessee State University, he was named All-Sunbelt Conference in 2008… Won the 2005 Kentucky State Amateur Championship, becoming the youngest winner in tournament history at age 18.
tourBios.personal: Attended Heath High School in Paducah…His uncle, Russ Cochran, played on the PGA TOUR and is currently a Champions Tour player…If he weren't playing golf he would be a professional fisherman…Would like to trade places with Rory McIlroy on Sunday of a major to learn how to win…Would like to be on the cover of a Cabela's catalog because he would receive free hunting and fishing equipment and that would mean he has done something very special in that field…Favorite professional teams are the Chicago Cubs and the Tennessee Titans…Dream foursome would be Jack Nicklaus, Lee Trevino and Greg Norman…Favorite website is PGATOUR.COM and favorite athlete is Kobe Bryant…Biggest thrills outside of golf are getting married, learning his wife was pregnant and finding out they were having a boy…Favorite vacation spot is the Dominican Republic…Twitter handle is @rick_cochran.

tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Top-75 Money Winner from 2015 Web.com Tour Regular Season

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T4th in 2015 at the Chitimacha Louisiana Open presented by NACHER.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 53rd in Heat Index(Money)-last 4 evts on the Web.com Tour.
